turn.10: Using ATA hard disk drives over 128 GiB in size requires system support 48-bit LBA; however, in Linux, uses the kernel to read or write to device files instead of accessing hardware directly.
turn.11: When was the last time Unix came out with an update?
turn.12: Support for 48-bit LBA has been present since version 2.4.23 of the kernel, released in 2003.
